info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 05 at 8:37AM MDT until June 09 at 7:42AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Glasgow affecting Valley County. For the Milk River...including Glasgow...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Glasgow. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Water begins to flow over Whately Road... which is about 7 miles east of Glasgow. Baseball field at Sullivan Park flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM MDT Monday the stage was 28.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM MDT Monday was 28.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain near or above minor flood stage through at least Thursday afternoon before gradually falling below flood stage by Friday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.2 feet on 05/12/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Milk River Glasgow 25.0 28.6 Mon 8 am MDT 26.8 26.8 25.2 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1000 PM MDT.
